column2: Responsibilites   Receive samples from Hospitals, Labs, Field executive and courier. Check for sample sufficiency, correct label, and completeness of TRF for acceptability. Ensure that the labels on the specimens coincide with the information provided TRF. Reject samples that do not meet criteria. Follow-up with the hospitals /clients in case of incomplete TRF, sample in sufficiency, spillage. Creating in-house Lab ID for each sample. Entry in Sample receiving registers. Handing over sample and TRF to lab for analysis. Maintenance of sample discard log of Freezer. Maintenance of sample outsource detail. Archiving of TRFs Handling of Calls Should also know phlebotomist Interested candidates please contact :7204407478 or share resume to varsha.sawant@hcgel.com

Collection of cord blood as per the SOP"s. You shall be required to go for cord blood collection at any time during the 24 hours of all the week days.      Collection of maternal blood.      Packaging dispatch of cord blood and maternal blood to laboratory after collection.      Attending biopsy and implantation surgery all over India.        Leading and imparting training to collection personnel spread across the country as per the standard operating procedures.      Provide solutions for any discrepancies in Cord Blood Collection.      Carry out any other job-related activities as and when deemed necessary.

column2: Jaslok Hospital Research Centre is looking for Technician - Blood Bank to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey        Blood Collection: Perform phlebotomy and collect blood from voluntary donors or patients as required, ensuring the process is safe, hygienic, and minimally discomforting to the donor      Blood Processing: Process collected blood and separate it into its components, such as red blood cells, plasma, and platelets, using centrifugation and other specialized equipment      Blood Testing: Conduct pre-transfusion compatibility testing and other required blood tests to determine blood group, type, and any potential infectious diseases, ensuring the safety of the blood supply      Record Keeping: Maintain accurate and detailed records of blood inventory, testing results, donor information, and other relevant data      Ensure proper documentation and adherence to regulatory requirements      Blood Storage and Inventory Management: Properly store blood products according to established guidelines, ensuring temperature monitoring and appropriate usage of blood supplies based on expiry dates      Equipment Maintenance: Regularly inspect, calibrate, and maintain blood bank equipment to ensure accuracy and reliability of test results and processes      Quality Control: Perform quality control checks and participate in proficiency testing to verify the accuracy of laboratory results and maintain high-quality standards      Emergency Response: Be prepared to respond to urgent blood requests and emergencies promptly and efficiently, ensuring that the right blood type is available for patients in critical situations      Donor Care: Provide care and support to blood donors during and after the donation process, ensuring their well-being and addressing any adverse reactions that may occur      Compliance and Safety: Adhere to all safety protocols, standard operating procedures, and regulatory guidelines, such as those from the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and other relevant bodies      Team Collaboration: Collaborate with other blood bank staff, healthcare professionals, and administrative personnel to ensure smooth operations and effective communication      Continuous Learning: Stay up-to-date with advancements in blood banking technology, safety protocols, and relevant regulations by participating in continuing education programs and training sessions
